text: My main suspicion is that inference perhaps got a bit less precise so something that used to infer down to something concrete perhaps doesn't anymore. Looking with `@code_warntype` and comparing betwen 1.6 and 1.4 might give something that is then easier to reduce in size.

text: It may be, hard to say. It is indeed involves a lot of dynamic dispatch calls and not everything is type stable. I still would not expect by any means tripled memory consumption since Julia v1.4. However I still have no clue what could be the cause of such a huge regression in my codebase, will try to look on it deeper.
